1.title: Sunil: Week One
1.plot: (Season Three premiere) A retired math professor from Bengal reluctantly visits Paul to discuss his wife's death six months earlier, his subsequent displacement to the U.S., and the recent tensions he's experienced while living with his son's family.

2.title: Frances: Week One
2.plot: A well-known stage and screen actress, whose sister was treated by Paul 18 years earlier, begins therapy to uncover the reasons why she is 'blanking out' during rehearsals for a new play.

3.title: Jesse: Week One
3.plot: A 16-year-old homosexual and aspiring photographer--who has been seeing Paul since being caught peddling prescription drugs--talks about his troubling 'pattern of promiscuity,' his unsettled family life, and a recent alarming voicemail.

4.title: Adele: Week One
4.plot: In order to get a new prescription for sleeping pills, an exhausted Paul visits a young, serious and intelligent therapist named Adele, and is compelled to confront a number of deep-rooted fears.

5.title: Sunil: Week Two
5.plot: Sunil opens up to Paul about his arranged marriage in India--and his frustrations living with Arun's family in New York.

6.title: Frances: Week Two
6.plot: Frances tells Paul about her frustrations at work, her alienation from daughter Izzy, and her fears about her health.

7.title: Jesse: Week Two
7.plot: Paul addresses Jesse's reluctance to get in touch with his long-lost birth mother.

8.title: Adele: Week Two
8.plot: Paul tells Adele he feels betrayed by Gina, and worries about the impact his potential illness will have on his children.

9.title: Sunil: Week Three
9.plot: Recounting his first impressions of Julia, Sunil becomes defensive when Paul suggests he may be jealous of Arun's choices.

10.title: Frances: Week Three
10.plot: A discussion about Frances' fractured relationship with Patricia turns into an indictment of their late mother.

11.title: Jesse: Week Three
11.plot: Paul tries to generate a dialogue between Jesse and his mother Marisa, who has joined him at the session.

12.title: Adele: Week Three
12.plot: Paul explores his fears of losing Max to a stepfather.

13.title: Sunil: Week Four
13.plot: Sunil finds haunting similarities between his son's relationship with Julia and his own affair years ago.

14.title: Frances: Week Four
14.plot: Paul tries to assuage Frances' feelings of self-loathing in the wake of some painful family memories.

15.title: Jesse: Week Four
15.plot: Paul breaks through with Jesse about his desire to connect with his birth parents.

16.title: Adele: Week Four
16.plot: Adele gets Paul to open up about his lack of passion.

17.title: Sunil: Week Five
17.plot: Unsettled by Julia's relationship with an author, Sunil worries Paul with his vivid account of a recent violent dream.

18.title: Frances: Week Five
18.plot: Exploring Frances' feelings of panic, Paul is accused of being overly sympathetic to her sister Tricia's plight.

19.title: Jesse: Week Five
19.plot: Paul is vexed to learn that Jesse sabotaged a meeting with his biological parents.

20.title: Adele: Week Five
20.plot: Adele confronts Paul about his growing obsession with an 'impossible' relationship.

21.title: Sunil: Week Six
21.plot: Paul is increasingly concerned over Sunil's erratic behavior at home.

22.title: Frances: Week Six
22.plot: With her sister's condition worsening, Frances turns to Paul to cope with her mounting anxieties.

23.title: Jesse: Week Six
23.plot: Jesse despairs that he will be abandoned by his parents, despite Paulʼs assurances.

24.title: Adele: Week Six
24.plot: Adele links Paul's frustrations to his inability to make decisions.

25.title: Frances: Week Seven
25.plot: Frances struggles with the prospect of losing her sister Tricia.

26.title: Sunil: Week Seven
26.plot: Paul is blindsided by a revelation regarding Sunilʼs therapy.

27.title: Jesse: Week Seven
27.plot: Paul tries to get Jesse to open up about a recent transgression and his relationship with his father Roberto.

28.title: Adele: Week Seven
28.plot: Blaming Adele for his recent setbacks with patients, Paul contemplates the future of his therapy and his practice.

1.title: Laura: Week One
1.plot: Laura reveals a sexual transgression. When Dr. Weston challenges Laura's reason for her actions Laura confides a secret she'd been withholding for nearly a year.

2.title: Alex: Week One
2.plot: An intense Navy pilot (Blair Underwood) puts Paul's credentials to the test, while recounting the unfortunate events in Iraq that drove him to therapy.

3.title: Sophie: Week One
3.plot: A precocious young gymnast (Mia Wasikowska) asks Paul to render his 'professional opinion' on an insurance report detailing the girl's recent, suspicious accident.

4.title: Jake and Amy: Week One
4.plot: A bickering husband and wife (Josh Charles and Embeth Davidtz) corner Paul on the issue they've spent the last three weeks debating: whether or not she should have an abortion.

5.title: Paul and Gina: Week One
5.plot: Worried he's 'losing patience with my patients,' Paul pays a visit to a retired therapist (Dianne Wiest) he'd last seen nearly ten years ago.

6.title: Laura: Week Two
6.plot: Laura announces her engagement to Andrew. Dr. Weston awkwardly attempts to discuss her decision increasing the level of tension between them.

7.title: Alex: Week Two
7.plot: Alex discusses his stoic return to the bombing scene, and reveals issues he has with his wife.

8.title: Sophie: Week Two
8.plot: Sophie vents about her team and her parents, and Paul surprises her with his psychological opinion.

9.title: Jake and Amy: Week Two
9.plot: After Jake and Amy's session ends abruptly, Paul's wife, Kate, forces him to confront the realities of their own marriage.

10.title: Paul and Gina: Week Two
10.plot: Paul's traumatic week leads Gina to make a suggestion that Paul rejects, pointing to Gina's own past in his defense.

11.title: Laura: Week Three
11.plot: Laura is late for her session which Dr. Weston interprets and a deliberate expression of anger. On leaving Laura meets Alex, another of Dr. Weston's patients.

12.title: Alex: Week Three
12.plot: Alex gives Paul surprising news about his encounter with another patient; Paul explores the similarities between Alex and his father.

13.title: Sophie: Week Three
13.plot: Paul probes the circumstances surrounding the breakup of Sophie's parents, as well as her relationship with her coach.

14.title: Jake and Amy: Week Three
14.plot: Amy examines her unusual reaction to her miscarriage, which ends up inciting Jake's suspicions.

15.title: Paul and Gina: Week Three
15.plot: Gina tries to get to the root of Paul's connection to Laura.

16.title: Laura: Week Four
16.plot: To Paul's discomfort, Laura describes in intimate detail her burgeoning relationship with Alex.

17.title: Alex: Week Four
17.plot: Alex describes his recent encounter with Laura, and questions whether therapy can help him.

18.title: Sophie: Week Four
18.plot: Exhausted from staying up all night, Sophie ends up detailing the events leading up to her accident.

19.title: Jake and Amy: Week Four
19.plot: Paul explores the issues that have fueled Jake and Amy's volatile relationship.

20.title: Paul and Gina: Week Four
20.plot: An old wound resurfaces as Gina and Paul debate the boundaries that exist between therapists and patients.

21.title: Laura: Week Five
21.plot: A close call at the hospital triggers unexpected revelations from Laura about an older man in her youth.

22.title: Alex: Week Five
22.plot: Alex's intimate knowledge of Paul's private life pushes the therapist to the brink.

23.title: Sophie: Week Five
23.plot: Sophie's mother joins her daughter's therapy session, and Paul witnesses first-hand the hostility and anger Sophie holds toward her.

24.title: Jake and Amy: Week Five
24.plot: The previous week's chaos gives way to a critical decision by Amy, and an emotional admission by Jake.

25.title: Paul and Gina: Week Five
25.plot: Kate joins Paul in therapy for the first time, where they begin examining the disintegration of their marriage.

26.title: Laura: Week Six
26.plot: Paul makes a point to Laura about fantasy and reality through the example of his own childhood infatuation.

27.title: Alex: Week Six
27.plot: After apologizing for crossing a boundary, Paul tries to decipher the meaning of one of Alex's recent dreams.

28.title: Sophie: Week Six
28.plot: Sophie's gusto evaporates after Paul presses her to confront her hidden anger toward her father.

29.title: Jake and Amy: Week Six
29.plot: Amy considers rejecting the new and improved Jake with a destructive alternative, eliciting a warning from Paul.

30.title: Paul and Gina: Week Six
30.plot: Paul and Kate's concern over daughter Rosie gives way to a heated exchange about Kate's role in Paul's life.

31.title: Laura: Week Seven
31.plot: Laura's absence gives Paul the opportunity to connect with Rosie and his oldest son Ian, with mixed results.

32.title: Alex: Week Seven
32.plot: Alex insists he's prepared for the commitment and structure that his marriage and career offer him.

33.title: Sophie: Week Seven
33.plot: Sophie attempts to convince Paul of the unique relationship she and her father share, and sees Paul as a threat in her dreams.

34.title: Jake and Amy: Week Seven
34.plot: Amy shocks Jake with a revelation tied to her connection with her father's death years before.

35.title: Paul and Gina: Week Seven
35.plot: Paul bristles at Kate and Rosie's secrets, but is surprised that Gina's obligatory therapy exercise proves helpful.

36.title: Laura: Week Eight
36.plot: A tragedy takes Paul away from the office, where a case of mistaken identity gets him in trouble.

37.title: Alex: Week Eight
37.plot: Paul upholds the merits of psychotherapy.

38.title: Sophie: Week Eight
38.plot: Paul tries to get an agitated Sophie to stop blaming herself for her parents' mistakes.

39.title: Jake and Amy: Week Eight
39.plot: A recent drive to his parents' home links Jake's problems with Amy to those with his father.

40.title: Paul and Gina: Week Eight
40.plot: Paul's lament about the value of therapy gives way to a surprising revelation from Gina.

41.title: Sophie: Week Nine
41.plot: Sophie comes to terms with her father's accountability, and asserts her own independence.

42.title: Jake and Amy: Week Nine
42.plot: Jake and Amy come to a resolution.

43.title: Paul and Gina: Week Nine
43.plot: In the season finale, Paul must face the consequences of his romantic pursuit of Laura.

1.title: Mia: Week One
1.plot: A surprise subpoena brings Paul back into the life of a former patient and current malpractice lawyer named Mia.

2.title: April: Week One
2.plot: Paul is alarmed to learn that his new patient April, an architecture student, harbors a life-threatening secret she refuses to share with her parents.

3.title: Oliver: Week One
3.plot: A conflicted sixth grader named Oliver is brought to Paul by his parents Bess and Luke, who are getting a divorce.

4.title: Walter: Week One
4.plot: A high-powered CEO with anxiety issues turns to Paul for therapy at the encouragement of his wife.

5.title: Gina: Week One
5.plot: Paul resumes his Friday sessions with Gina, who agrees to give a deposition in the lawsuit against him while also helping him through the new changes in his life.

6.title: Mia: Week Two
6.plot: In her first session, Mia admits to wanting to impress Paul by flaunting her job and relationship with a married co-worker.

7.title: April: Week Two
7.plot: April details her detachment from a former boyfriend and his current partner, both of whom are concerned about her current illness.

8.title: Oliver: Week Two
8.plot: Fearing his behavior has led to his parents' estrangement, Oliver outlines the difficulty he's having living between two homes.

9.title: Walter: Week Two
9.plot: Paul links Walter's panic attacks to a childhood tragedy.

10.title: Gina: Week Two
10.plot: Paul looks to fill in memory gaps about his mother's attempted suicide by reconnecting with a childhood crush.

11.title: Mia: Week Three
11.plot: Laura's deposition in the Alex Prince case spills into Paul's session with Mia.

12.title: April: Week Three
12.plot: April's memories of a childhood near-tragedy underscore her lifelong independence issues.

13.title: Oliver: Week Three
13.plot: Bess and Luke disagree over whether Oliver's weeklong stay at his father's was a success.

14.title: Walter: Week Three
14.plot: In the midst of a corporate crisis, Walter recounts an emotional attempt to rescue and protect his daughter.

15.title: Gina: Week Three
15.plot: Gina explores Paul's resentment over having to take care of his ailing father.

16.title: Mia: Week Four
16.plot: Paul exposes the emotional insecurity that may have led to Mia's recent unruly weekend.

17.title: April: Week Four
17.plot: Paul crosses a professional boundary after analyzing April's anxieties involving her brother and mother.

18.title: Oliver: Week Four
18.plot: Despite Bess' assurances, Paul worries that Oliver's recent exemplary behavior is merely an illusion.

19.title: Walter: Week Four
19.plot: Walter confronts his feelings of duty and loss in the wake of a professional 'perfect storm.'

20.title: Gina: Week Four
20.plot: Gina encourages Paul to reconnect with his father before it is too late.

21.title: Mia: Week Five
21.plot: Paul and Mia examine issues of life, death, loneliness and last chances.

22.title: April: Week Five
22.plot: April's revelation about her best friend Leah triggers a discussion with Paul about reliance-and April's unwillingness to lean on those closest to her.

23.title: Oliver: Week Five
23.plot: Oliver's recent deteriorating behavior at home and school vexes his father, who's dealing with personal issues of his own.

24.title: Walter: Week Five
24.plot: Paul concludes that Walter's recent actions make him a risk to himself.

25.title: Gina: Week Five
25.plot: Gina tries to get Paul to address unanswered questions about his father; Alex Sr. drops a bombshell.

26.title: Mia: Week Six
26.plot: A recent setback allows Paul to help Mia re-examine her contentious relationship with her mother.

27.title: April: Week Six
27.plot: Accused of betrayal, Paul defends his actions while addressing April's deep-rooted insecurities.

28.title: Oliver: Week Six
28.plot: Ignoring Paul's and Oliver's objections, Luke and Bess come up with a plan that will alter their family structure and dynamics.

29.title: Walter: Week Six
29.plot: Paul tries to get Walter to embrace his vulnerable side.

30.title: Gina: Week Six
30.plot: Gina bristles over a frustrated Paul's accusation that she's not involved with her patients.

31.title: Mia: Week Seven
31.plot: After failing to lure Paul into a trap, Mia ends up making a life-changing decision.

32.title: April: Week Seven
32.plot: April shares some news with Paul that sets the stage for a dialogue about facing her anger, and her future.

33.title: Oliver: Week Seven
33.plot: Bess and Luke find closure after a tough week; Paul tries to allay Oliver's fears.

34.title: Walter: Week Seven
34.plot: Paul maps out a plan to rescue Walter from his old self.

35.title: Gina: Week Seven
35.plot: Paul bristles at Kate and Rosie's secrets, but is surprised that Gina's obligatory therapy exercise proves helpful.

locations: Paramount Studios - 5555 Melrose Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA::(studio)
imdb.title: In Treatment
plot: A psychotherapist questions his abilities and gets help by reuniting with his old therapist, whom he has not seen for ten years.::IMDb editor
synopsis: A psychotherapist , Paul (Gabriel Byrne), treats three new patients a season, two on Monday nights and a third on Tuesday when he, also, sees his own psychotherapist, Adele (Amy Ryan, new in season three replacing Diane Wiest from season 1-2). This is a change in format from season one when it was shown on five consecutive nights. The patients are varied ranging in age from elderly people to juveniles with family, career, romantic, and other life problems which are usually resolved by season's end.In season two, Paul (Byrne) wrestles with life changes arising from his divorce. His move from the family home in Maryland to Brooklyn, NY brings with it's own set of new problems. There he has started a practice with new patients working from an office in his apartment.Season three finds him with a new therapist, Adele (Amy Ryan) because his former therapist (Wiest) has closed the door on any new sessions and has written a book that Paul feels portrays him in a very demeaning way. A new issue has arisen in season three regarding his possible inheritance of the Parkinson's gene from his father as he believes he is exhibiting symptoms now. He also develops an attachment of sorts to Adele which she may or may not share. Paul dates a much younger woman, Wendy, but doesn't seem to have formed a strong bond with her. His teenage son, Max, has come to live with him in Brooklyn and Paul has difficulty communicating with him.In season three Paul struggles with his three new patients: Sunil (Irrfan Khan), Frances (Debra Winger), and Jesse (Dane DeHaan). Sunil has come from India to live with his son's family where he feels he has now lost his dignity. He and his daughter-in-law cannot get along and differ on most subjects. Frances (a famous actress) has a sister dying and she can't seem to cope with it, nor her own fears of developing the breast cancer that has killed her mother and now her sister. Jesse is an adopted teenager whose birth parents are trying to contact him. He has been in conflict with his adoptive parents as he questions his sexual identity.Paul has difficulty keeping a distance with his patients becoming very emotional about their situations. He tries to convey this to his therapist who seems cold and inflexible.
